knowledge.progressSummary: BLOCKED: DirichletsTheorem.lean written but requires PrimesInAP (not in our Mathlib). Elementary Fermat proof possible but not yet implemented.
builtItems: DirichletsTheorem.infinitely_many_primes_1_mod_4 - statement exists but proof uses unavailable Mathlib
insights: Elementary proof exists via Fermat's two squares theorem: primes p|n²+1 satisfy p ≡ 1 mod 4
Every odd prime factor of N is ≡ 1 mod 4 (since -1 is QR mod p iff p ≡ 1 mod 4)
At least one such prime is new (not in {p₁,...,pₖ})
This proof does NOT require Dirichlet's full theorem - only Fermat's two squares
mathlibGaps: PrimesInAP not in our Mathlib (Sept 2024) - blocks the Dirichlet approach
Elementary proof via Fermat would work with current Mathlib but not yet implemented
nextSteps: Implement elementary proof using Fermat's two squares (Mathlib has Nat.Prime.sq_add_sq)
Alternative: upgrade Mathlib to get PrimesInAP and use full Dirichlet
